sources.title: The Uninvited (1944)
sources.description: "The Uninvited"  is a classic supernatural horror film directed by Lewis Allen . This film is notable for its chilling atmosphere and engaging storytelling, making it one of the early standout haunted house films in American cinema. The story revolves around a brother and sister,  Roderick (played by Ray Milland ) and Pamela (played by Gail Russell ), who purchase a beautiful but eerie mansion on the coast of England. Soon after moving in, they encounter supernatural occurrences and a haunting spirit, which they learn is tied to the tragic history of the house, specifically involving a young woman named Mary .

metadata.Plot: A brother and sister move into an old seaside house they find abandoned for many years on the English coast. Their original enchantment with the house diminishes as they hear stories of the previous owners and meet their daughter (now a young woman) who now lives as a neighbor with her grandfather. Also heard are unexplained sounds during the night. It becomes obvious that the house is haunted. The reasons for the haunting and how they relate to the daughter whom the brother is falling in love with, prove to be a complex mystery. As they are compelled to solve it, the supernatural activity at the house increases to a frightening level.
metadata.Writer: Dodie Smith, Frank Partos, Dorothy Macardle
metadata.Actors: Ray Milland, Ruth Hussey, Donald Crisp
metadata.Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. 2 wins & 1 nomination total
